title: How to Gain Weight Fast (for Women)

steps.title: Consume an additional 500 calories per day.
steps.content: Consume an additional 500 calories per day. It is generally safe to gain 1–2 pounds (0.45–0.91 kg) per week. To reach this goal, add an extra 500 calories to your diet every day. The healthiest way to do this is to eat more nutrient-dense foods. [1] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source To keep track of what you’re eating, use a health app, such as MyFitnessPal . Write down everything you eat and how much exercise you do. Once a week, record your weight. Talk with your doctor or a registered dietitian to determine your ideal weight. You can also calculate your healthy weight with a Body Mass Index (BMI) calculator. For most people, a healthy BMI falls between 18.5-24.9. [2] X Trustworthy Source National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute Research and education center within the National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Increase your portion size.
steps.content: Increase your portion size. Eat a second helping of food or add more food to your plate when you begin. If you’re finding it hard to eat a larger meal , avoid drinking too many fluids beforehand so that you have more of an appetite at mealtime. [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If eating a double portion is too much, try increasing the portion over time. [4] X Research source Start with an extra scoop of rice or add a sweet potato on the side. As time goes on, slowly add more food to your meal.

steps.title: Eat several small meals if you don’t like larger meals.
steps.content: Eat several small meals if you don’t like larger meals. For some people, eating larger portion sizes may not be an appealing option. Instead of increasing portion sizes, try to eat 6 smaller meals throughout the day. These meals can include breakfast , lunch, dinner, and 3 snacks. [5] X Research source As a general rule, eat once every 3-4 hours pass while awake.

steps.title: Avoid drinking 30 minutes before a meal.
steps.content: Avoid drinking 30 minutes before a meal. Liquids can fill you up, making it harder for you to finish a full meal. Wait until after you have finished eating to get a drink. [6] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Indulge in a snack before bed.
steps.content: Indulge in a snack before bed. If you eat a snack or small meal before bed, your body won't have a chance to burn it off before you sleep. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Stick with nutritious snacks, like a banana with almond butter, oatmeal, a piece of fruit, or some yogurt. [8] X Research source If you enjoy dessert, save it for bedtime. You might eat a bowl of fruit, a serving of ice cream, or a few pieces of chocolate . If you prefer savory foods, try eating a bowl of pasta or cheese and crackers.

steps.title: Stimulate your appetite before eating meals.
steps.content: Stimulate your appetite before eating meals. There are many things you can do to feel hungrier before eating. These tricks can help you eat more at a meal. Some easy ways to increase your appetite include: [9] X Trustworthy Source University of Rochester Medical Center Leading academic medical center in the U.S. focused on clinical care and research Go to source Take a short walk before meals. Exercise can help you feel hungrier. Prepare foods that you enjoy. Make your favorite comfort food to encourage yourself to eat it all. Try new recipes. This can help you feel more excited about trying your meal. Eat in a calm, comfortable atmosphere. If you’re tense or distracted, you may not want to eat as much.

steps.title: Consume high-calorie and nutrient-dense foods.
steps.content: Consume high-calorie and nutrient-dense foods. Fast food and processed meals may be high in calories, but they provide empty calories that don’t contain many nutrients. Nutrient-dense foods pack in more calories and more good fats, protein, vitamins, and minerals. [10] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source For grains, eat heavy breads like whole wheat and pumpernickel. Bran muffins, whole wheat bread, and wheat germ are also good choices. When it comes to fruit, choose bananas, pineapples, raisins, dried fruit, and avocados . In general, starchy fruits are preferable to water-rich fruits, like watermelon or oranges, as they contain more calories and nutrients. For vegetables, try peas , corn, potatoes, and winter squash. As with fruit, starchy vegetables are better than water-rich vegetables. Within the dairy group, consider cheese , ice cream, frozen yogurt, and whole milk.

steps.title: Aim for 3 food groups in a meal.
steps.content: Aim for 3 food groups in a meal. When eating a snack or meal, don’t just eat 1 type of food. Incorporate a few different food groups into what you eat throughout the day. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source This will increase the calorie count while making it easier for you to eat more. For example, don’t just eat toast. Try to top the toast with peanut butter and adding sliced bananas on top. Or place sliced avocado on top with a glass of kefir on the side. If you enjoy eggs in the morning, try scrambling them with peppers and sausage. Instead of just eating a cup of yogurt, sprinkle granola and berries on top.

steps.title: Drink more of your food if you struggle with solid meals.
steps.content: Drink more of your food if you struggle with solid meals. Sometimes, it can be hard to motivate yourself to eat extra snacks (like fruits and vegetables). Try drinking high-calorie drinks in between meals if you can't stomach a snack (and want to enjoy some fruits and veggies in the process). [12] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Smoothies are great, especially those made with whole fruits and vegetables and yogurt. Juice made from real fruit adds extra vitamins and fiber to your meal. Milk, milkshakes , protein shakes are also good options.

steps.title: Add extra ingredients to meals.
steps.content: Add extra ingredients to meals. You can stir high-calorie, nutritious foods or powders into your favorite meals to add extra calories without making you feel much fuller. Some great ways to do this include: [13] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source Stir powdered milk into beverages, soups, stews, and sauces. Sprinkle nuts over your salad or cereal. Stir ground flaxseed into salads, cereals, and smoothies. Sprinkle cheese over your casseroles, soups, scrambled eggs, salads, and sandwiches. Spread butter, nut butter, or cream cheese over toast, crackers, or rolls.

steps.title: Cook with oil and butter.
steps.content: Cook with oil and butter. Cooking foods in oil and butter will increase a dish's total number of calories without adding more food to your plate. [14] X Research source Good fats to cook with include: [15] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source Olive oil , which contains 119 calories per 1 Tbsp (15 ml). Canola oil, which contains 120 calories per 1 Tbsp (15 ml). Coconut oil, which contains 117 calories per 1 Tbsp (15 ml). Butter, which contains 102 calories per 1 Tbsp (15 ml).

steps.title: Consume more protein if you want to build muscle.
steps.content: Consume more protein if you want to build muscle. Muscle weighs more than body fat, which means that building muscle is a great way to gain weight without gaining fat. Protein is essential to helping your body build muscle mass. [16] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Lean meats and eggs are great sources of protein. Some good vegetarian options include peas, nuts, hummus, and beans. Protein bars and shakes make for great snacks. They pack in extra protein and other nutrients.

steps.title: Treat any underlying medical conditions.
steps.content: Treat any underlying medical conditions. Certain medications and conditions can make it hard to gain weight. If this is the case, make sure you’re treating your medical condition. Talk to your doctor to find the right options for you. [17] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you have lost a significant amount of weight without explanation, see your doctor to make sure that you do not have an underlying condition, such as a thyroid or digestive disorder.

steps.title: Talk to a registered dietitian.
steps.content: Talk to a registered dietitian. A registered dietitian can help you design meal plans to help you reach your weight goals in a healthy manner. They can also provide advice about exercising or stimulating your appetite. [18] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Ask your doctor to refer you to a registered dietitian.

steps.title: Quit smoking.
steps.content: Quit smoking. The nicotine in a smoked cigarette suppresses your appetite. [19] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Smoking can also affect your sense of taste and smell. [20] X Research source Talk to your doctor to discuss strategies for quitting smoking. Your doctor may be able to prescribe a path or pill to help you quit. [21] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source If you cannot quit smoking , try to avoid smoking for an hour or 2 before you eat a meal.

steps.title: Start strength training to build muscle.
steps.content: Start strength training to build muscle. While not the fastest option, strength training is a good idea if you want to stay in control of your weight. [22] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Strength training, in particular, is especially good because it allows you to gain weight by building your muscles. [23] X Research source Weight training is a great place to start. You can also do body weight exercises like yoga or Pilates . Avoid too much cardio or aerobic exercise, as they may prevent you from gaining weight. Eating extra protein is especially important if you plan to build muscle mass through exercise. Good strength training exercises include squats, deadlifts, overhead presses, bench presses, barbell rows, dips, chin-ups, crunches, bicep curls, leg presses, and leg curls.
